CatDescriptText: Portions of article for related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 10, 1953, pg. 10, reads: "Denice [sic] Mae Thomas and Earl F. McGuire Have Beautiful Wedding At Corpus Christi - Corpus Christi Catholic Church was the scene Saturday, Oct. 3. of the nuptial mass of Denise Mae Thomas, lovely daughter of Mrs. Dennis L. Thomas and the late Mr. Thomas, and Earl Francis McGuire, son of Mr. and Mrs. Earl McGuire Sr. She was given in marriage by her brother-in-law, Jesse Holliday. Father Connelly officiated.  The bride chose for her wedding a gorgeous gown of ivory satin, tulle, and nylon lace.  Her gown had a flowing skirt of satin, accented with tiers of tulle and lace, and a yoke of tulle, outline in sequins...four bridesmaids, Ann Holliday, sister of the bride; Teresa McGuire, sister of the groom; Kathleen Hurst and Joan Bruce.  Delores Talson was maid of honor....LIttle Judy Haines, dressed in an identical gown as that of the bride, was flower girl.  Thomas Holliday was ring bearer.  Andrew McGuire served as his brother's best man, and ushers were Louis McGuire, the groom's brother; James Moore, Herbert Willis and George Anderson... Immediately after the ceremony the wedding party was served breakfast at the Greene Hearthe.  At 1 o'clock guest were received at the same place...Senior aides were Mmes Mary Douglass, Kathleen Douglass, Julia Calloway, Hattie Greene, Mary Holloman, Ada Rickmond, Jesse L. Vann, Lulu Lewis, Harriet Lewis.  Junior aides were Bea Harris, Adelaide Montgomery, Odell King, Rebecca Armstrong, Janice Dent, Geraldine Gilbert, Delores Anderson, Joan Gainer, Audrey McDaniel..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of bride Denise Mae Thomas McGuire wearing gown with full skirt, sheer gathered neck, long lace sleeves, and long lace trimmed veil and train, posed in Greene Hearth
